Package paintingcanvas.animation

Interface Animatable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    App.AnimationBuilder, Circle, Drawable, Ellipse, Line, Path, Polygon, Rectangle, Square, Text, Triangle
    public interface Animatable
    An interface to call animation methods on animatable objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      App.AnimationBuilder animate()
      Create an App.AnimationBuilder.
      default App.AnimationBuilder colorTo​(int hex, double duration)
      Change the color of this to the specified color over duration seconds.
      default App.AnimationBuilder colorTo​(int r, int g, int b, double duration)
      Change the color of this to the specified color over duration seconds.
      default App.AnimationBuilder colorTo​(java.awt.Color color, double duration)
      Change the color of this to the specified color over duration seconds.
      Drawable<?> drawable()
      Get the Drawable element from this Animatable.
      default App.AnimationBuilder fadeIn​(double duration)
      Fades this in over @{code duration} seconds.
      default App.AnimationBuilder fadeOut​(double duration)
      Fades this out over @{code duration} seconds.
      default App.AnimationBuilder moveBy​(int x, int y, double duration)
      This method moves this by the specified x and y
      default App.AnimationBuilder moveHorizontalBy​(int x, double duration)
      This method moves this by the specified x horizontally.
      default App.AnimationBuilder moveTo​(int x, int y, double duration)
      Move this to the specified x and y over duration seconds
      default App.AnimationBuilder moveVerticalBy​(int y, double duration)
      This method moves this by the specified x horizontally.
      default App.AnimationBuilder rotateBy​(int angle, double duration)
      Rotates this by angle°.
      default App.AnimationBuilder rotateTo​(int angle, double duration)
      Rotates this to the specified angle°.

    • Method Detail

      • animate

        App.AnimationBuilder animate()
        Create an App.AnimationBuilder. Used to animate different properties of an element (position, rotation, color). 
        
 Circle o = new Circle(100, 100, 20);

 // Animate Circle o to move to 200, 200 for 3 seconds
 o.animate().add(moveTo(200, 200), 3);
        Returns:
        App.AnimationBuilder

      • drawable

        Drawable<?> drawable()
        Get the Drawable element from this Animatable.
        Returns:
        the Drawable

      • moveTo

        default App.AnimationBuilder moveTo​(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    double duration)
        Move this to the specified x and y over duration seconds 
        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will move to (100, 100), and then to (200, 200)
 c.moveTo(100, 100, 3).moveTo(200, 200, 3);
        Parameters:
        x - the x-position to move to
        y - the y-position to move to
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder

      • colorTo

        default App.AnimationBuilder colorTo​(int r,
                                     int g,
                                     int b,
                                     double duration)
        Change the color of this to the specified color over duration seconds. See Wikipedia for how this works. 
        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will turn red, and then blue
 c.colorTo(255, 0, 0, 3).colorTo(0, 0, 255, 3);
        Parameters:
        r - red (0-255)
        g - green (0-255)
        b - blue (0-255)
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder

      • colorTo

        default App.AnimationBuilder colorTo​(int hex,
                                     double duration)
        Change the color of this to the specified color over duration seconds. See Wikipedia for how this works. 
        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will turn red, and then blue
 c.colorTo(0xFF0000, 3).colorTo(0x0000FF, 3);
        Parameters:
        hex - The number describing the RGB color
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder

      • colorTo

        default App.AnimationBuilder colorTo​(java.awt.Color color,
                                     double duration)
        Change the color of this to the specified color over duration seconds. See Color for the full list of colors, and constructors for this class 
        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will turn red, and then blue
 c.colorTo(Color.RED, 3).colorTo(Color.BLUE, 3);
        Parameters:
        color - The color to fade to
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder

      • fadeOut

        default App.AnimationBuilder fadeOut​(double duration)
        Fades this out over @{code duration} seconds. 
        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will fade out, then in
 c.fadeOut(3).fadeIn(3);
        Parameters:
        duration - the amount of time it takes to fade out
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder
        See Also:
        fadeIn(double)

      • fadeIn

        default App.AnimationBuilder fadeIn​(double duration)
        Fades this in over @{code duration} seconds. 
        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will fade out, then in
 c.fadeOut(3).fadeIn(3);
        Parameters:
        duration - the amount of time it takes to fade out
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder
        See Also:
        fadeOut(double)

      • rotateTo

        default App.AnimationBuilder rotateTo​(int angle,
                                      double duration)
        Rotates this to the specified angle°. If you supply an angle > 360 it will make more than one full rotation. 
        
 Square s = new Square(200, 200, 50);
 // the square will rotate one turn counter-clockwise, then 2 turns clockwise
 c.rotateTo(360, 3).colorTo(-360, 3);
        Parameters:
        angle - The absolute angle to rotate to in degrees.
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder
        See Also:
        animate()

      • rotateBy

        default App.AnimationBuilder rotateBy​(int angle,
                                      double duration)
        Rotates this by angle°. 
        
 Square s = new Square(200, 200, 50);
 // the square will rotate one turn counter-clockwise, then one turns clockwise
 c.rotateTo(360, 3).colorTo(-360, 3);
        Parameters:
        angle - The relative angle to rotate to in degrees.
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder

      • moveBy

        default App.AnimationBuilder moveBy​(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    double duration)
        This method moves this by the specified x and y 
        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will move down 100, and then right 200
 c.moveBy(0, 100, 3).moveBy(200, 0, 3);
        Parameters:
        x - the x to move by
        y - the y to move by
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder

      • moveHorizontalBy

        default App.AnimationBuilder moveHorizontalBy​(int x,
                                              double duration)

        This method moves this by the specified x horizontally. Positive values move right, negative values move left.

        This method is equivalent to moveBy(x, 0, duration) 

        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will move right 300 pixels over 3 seconds
 c.moveHorizontalBy(0, 100, 3);
        Parameters:
        x - the x to move by
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder

      • moveVerticalBy

        default App.AnimationBuilder moveVerticalBy​(int y,
                                            double duration)

        This method moves this by the specified x horizontally. Positive values move right, negative values move left.

        This method is equivalent to moveBy(0, y, duration) 

        
 Circle c = new Circle(200, 200, 50);
 // the circle will move right 300 pixels over 3 seconds
 c.moveHorizontalBy(0, 100, 3);
        Parameters:
        y - the y to move by
        duration - the number of seconds it lasts
        Returns:
        an App.AnimationBuilder
